website_summaries.verdict: An all-inclusive pet clipper set. Fuss-free home grooming for fine to medium coats. The best value available.
pros: Strong motor, yet quiet enough for most pets
7 attachment guide combs, stainless steel scissors, styling apron, blade oil, storage case, and instructional DVD
cons: Not suitable for larger breeds with heavy coats
Produces a loud click when switching on that may startle some dogs
Blades heat up after a while

customer_reviews.title: Works great, cat expressed its displeasure though.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well on my Coon's arse. Very silent! Take each pass carefully, taking a bit off at a time. My coon takes a few poobles with him after poops a few times a week. For my somewhat germaphobic SO this is a problem. A quick shave and for the last month his poo-trophies are few and far between. One warning though, when grooming a cat - they can express their anal glands at you if nervous. The included apron comes in *very* handy. These two statements are very strongly connected. Good luck and try not to be at eye level.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kumar

customer_reviews.title: broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to groom our pup. The every first time we used it it broke. We were already pass the amazon return time so we couldn't exchange or return it. Would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: I believe these are a good investment. Here is a picture of my cat ...
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased these clippers for my cat. So far I have no complaints about these clippers. I believe these are a good investment. Here is a picture of my cat after his hair cut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wahl clipper
customer_reviews.text: I Never groomed my dog and she hates going to the groomer. After reading other reviews I decided to try this. It was so easy and very quiet. My dog who is a beagle/schitzu mix and she actually was not nervous at all. I highly recommend this clipper. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: To actually do its job.
customer_reviews.text: I have a goldendoodle that I keep cut short because he stays hot. First time using stopped cutting not even half way into starting. I oiled several times, and let them cool down even though they weren't hot. Still would not cut. (Yes, I washed, dried & brushed before attempting to cut) my last Wahl brand lasted a year. I bought this type because it was top 10 best clippers for doodle/poodle brand dogs. I do not recommend. VERY disappointed. I would return,but threw away the barcode because I did not expect them not to work.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this trimmer due to the very high sound it
customer_reviews.text: After having it for three months, I finally got the guts to open the package and trim my Cocker Spaniel’s hair. After reading the long instruction sheet I plugged the trimmer in and was shocked at how loud the trimmer is. Just by listening to the high sound of the trimmer my dog got scared. I thus decided not to do it and accept this as a loss and a failed purchase. I do not recommend this trimmer due to the very high sound it makes
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Samer K. Zawaideh

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and handy!!
customer_reviews.text: Our poodle puppy was in need of a face shave. This clipper is quiet and doesn't get hot quickly. I did have to resort to not using a guard because I wanted it so short but the guards in use are also excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I paid less than $40 for these clippers. I have two small dogs who cost $43 each for one visit to the groomer. In just one clipping, it paid for itself! I was absolutely amazed at the cutting power. It cuts through their hair/fur like butter and it's not loud at all. This was my first time cutting my own dogs, so I was simply amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: These clippers are not recommended for thick coats
customer_reviews.text: These clippers are not recommended for thick coats. I thought they would work for my Yorkie because his fur is fine, but there is a lot of it and it was grown out about 2". I got the job done with these but it's all uneven and looks terrible. And it took forever running the clippers through over and over. They got so hot they almost burned me. And the guards are so pointy on the end that they can poke. These are fine for a light trim on a Yorkie with a short coat. But for a full groom on a winter weight coat, no good. I'm going to return them for a more expensive heavy duty set.
customer_reviews.author: Jenelle L. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: How to shave a cat
customer_reviews.text: We have a crafty, ornery short-furred female tabby: basically, a European Wildcat. About twice a year, her dense fur becomes impossibly and uncomfortably matted. The Wahl works quickly, painlessly, and perfectly. Very simple, safe, and powerful. Working together, and with a towel wrap to prevent biting and scratching (by the cat) my spouse and we can shave the matted hair on half our cat's back within only a couple of minutes. And little Shaitana is so much happier!
customer_reviews.author: David Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. after using it twice and quit working
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after 2 months ...Trying to return but no place to contact seller .Will try to contact Amazon to see what I can do. Very disappointed.after using it twice and quit working.
customer_reviews.author: priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 3 maltipoos
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur dog trimmer with this Wahl. I've used ones that last one time and cost $20. These were $40 and we're in 2 dogs going strong. It hasn't been easy, but possible with these trimmers. Both my wife and I have used them on poodle hair and they are great. I may get another pair to do 2 dogs at once. 3rd dog in and we've found the shorter attachments like 1 and 2 work better and cut right through mats. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Guards do not work!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried trimming our Maltese a few times with these clippers. The guards do not protect the skin from nicks and have caused severe bleeding! The clippers blades often get jammed with hair. You have to remove the guard and use the little brush provided to clean up the blades with each pass you make (super annoying). The unit itself gets hot to the touch quickly. We have had to stop in the middle of a trim to let the clippers cool down so we don’t burn our own hands. The clippers aren’t very quiet. We will be getting rid of these right away, no chance of donating— these are going straight in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great but not for large coarse hair breeds
customer_reviews.text: Did not cut the mustard per say for my dogs. I have Poodles with coarse hair and this just did not have the power to cut or precisely suit the needs of grooming for me or my dogs so it was returned. It does shave well on fine haired dogs that need minimal trims.
customer_reviews.author: LibertyStarr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but need to practice.
customer_reviews.text: Found this clipper easy to use on our dogs (a golden mix and more of a jack Russell terrier mix). They were used to going to get groomed so we had no trouble with them standing still and the noise of the clippers didn't bother them, but if your dog is a novice, the noise level might be a little scary. Watched the video included and some on the internet, but still need to practice to get a professional clip - but that is just us, not the clippers. Would highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. Vibrated loudly & got uncomfortably hot.
customer_reviews.text: At ~$100/- this is a pretty pricey clipper... and I expected to get something which works smoothly. I used this clipper the past weekend and found two issues: 1. The unit got quite uncomfortably hot. Given its a professional grade clipper, I was very surprised as I was clipping one small shichon dog ( 14lbs) . 2. This clipper was not quiet. The vibration/noise from this clipper was uncomfortable. I could see it bothered my dog.
customer_reviews.author: regulus

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and easy operation
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to groom our PomChi. She has thick fast growing hair and previous trimmers were loud and scared her. These are whisper quiet and she was not nervous at all. We used a larger trimmer attachment to trim her hair shorter, then used another attachment to get it closer to the skin. The unit did not get hot and there were no issues at all with its performance. There are ample instructions on how to groom your pet so read up before you start. One tip, let the trimmers glide on the hair, don't push down to get more hair, as youll have lines of uneven hair. Easy to use and saved us money on a groomer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Borrelli

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Well, I think there could be better instructions and the first time I tried to use them I couldn't even get them to cut any hair but it was operator error! My daughter has groomed her dog for years and she showed me how to hold the clippers at the proper angle and they cut fine if used correctly. I only use them after the dog has been bathed to keep the blades sharp. We are on about his 5th hair cut and they are doing fine. I, on the other hand, am a lousy dog groomer but getting better with practice.
customer_reviews.author: elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great for Humans - Garbage for pets. (Do NOT cut CAT HAIR)
customer_reviews.text: uh ya... these do not cut CAT HAIR. I tried - looked up youtube ect. I ended up getting some Oster Sheers and they work fine. MIND YOU: I have used Wahl to cut my own hair for the past 20 years - but these are Garbage in regards to pets. Sorry - I dont want another person to go through what I did.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Exact same version as regular mens trimmer. Does not work on poodle/lab
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the same as any personal grooming model. To weak for trimming lab/poodle hair. Jams and clogs on dog hair constantly. Cord limits movement. After attempting to use this I had to take my dog to the groomer anyway. I watched behind the counter and spied on the model they were using. Got a usb recharge cordless model for almost the same price, also from amazon, and the difference is substantial!
customer_reviews.author: Trenton

customer_reviews.title: Not so bad
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a huge knot and I was able to remote it with the clippers. It isn’t silent so it may startle your pet. It comes in a sturdy plastic compact travel case and includes a grooming apron as well as a scissor and a cleaning brush with cleaning solution for the clippers. When turned on the vibration was hard and kinda numbed my hand making it difficult to groom for a long time. It also gets super hot so I turn it off because I get scared something can happen. Other than that it’s not bad. Another plus is that the cord is really long so you can actually move around more.
customer_reviews.author: Zuleimy1

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA and it shows
customer_reviews.text: This product is clearly made with all quality materials. I’ve used trimmers before that are made in China and they are inferior in every sense. I only wondered about origin of manufacturing after firing this up the first time. It was hefty, it was strong, it was fast. Unfortunately I had to return because I have a double coated dog and shaving them is not ideal. I’m going to keep my eye out for their products and recommend to anyone. I will be purchasing a product if theirs whenever the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Güerito

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for our cocker puppy just to try clipping her at home to see if I could. These clippers worked wonderfully for the price of one groomers cut. So they have saved money. I have used them five times with no problems (which was surprising because of her massive amounts of thick hair). I highly recommend trying these before spending big money on professional groomer clippers. The only thing I noticed that might be an issue is after 45 minutes they do get hot but a short break or quick cut should can help avoid this. All around great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jenlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, gets the job done and easy to use. Would recommend ordering the clipper spray oil to keep them working well, worth it!
customer_reviews.author: torigirl

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers for a novice groomer
customer_reviews.text: I had never groomed a dog before or used a set of clippers on anyone. I was getting pretty sick of paying 50 bucks every other month to get my mini schnauzer cut so figured I would give these a whirl. They work great, really easy to use, come with some decent directions, though the video included is pretty lame. These were definitely worth the small investment. I must say that I now never take my dog to the groomers and no one is the wiser.
customer_reviews.author: FieryNess

customer_reviews.title: Spend a Little More on a Better Product
customer_reviews.text: The blade does not do well with thick fur; and I'm only cutting the fur on an 11 pound Maltipoo. The fur gets between the blade on the first pass, you have to take the blade apart constantly to clear out the fur. Eventually the blades get so dull that they stop cutting all together. This model is too weak for pet grooming.
customer_reviews.author: Pana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome clippers
customer_reviews.text: Ok I have 2 shih tzus decided to try trimming some of their fur them little until I’m able to get to the dog groomers. The tutorial dvd was good tells you what to do and preparing. Started with one dog and wow for a beginner I think I did pretty good and do did baby the clippers were easy to handle and not loud at all. Time to do my second dog thanks Wahl for great clippers and Amazon quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Sharnell  Easley

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for Shih Tzu
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try these clippers out on our Shih Tzu, We washed and brushed him, got him set for the grooming, and what a massive disappointment. Either these clippers weren't sharp enough, or they lack enough power, but for whatever reason they bogged down, and I had to push hard to get them to cut. To make matters worse, the hair would collect in the blades, and I had to constantly remove the grooming comb, pull the hair out and put the comb back on. Returning after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: You need this.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the best animal fur clipper I've used. It does a great job on thicker coats, is easy to handle, and very sturdy. It does get a bit of heat to it if you hold it for a long time (e.g. with a skiddish dog who needs you to be extra slow).
customer_reviews.author: Kelli HTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Unwieldy cord and rather under powered.
customer_reviews.text: What irritates me the most about this clipper is the rather stiff, unwieldy cord. I have other handheld machines that use far more electricity and their cords are much softer and pleasant to use. It feels like the manufacturer went for the cheapest possible cord to save a few cents. If the fur of the dog is coarse, it will cut OK, but if it is fine, you will almost have to feed it to machine in order of making it cut.
customer_reviews.author: Danwood

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well at all
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Yorkies, and I had a neck of a time with , this shaver. Cloged easily. Very loud. And wasn t anything , like the disception
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Buying my next set- 4-years after the first!
customer_reviews.text: I need a new set of grooming tools as the last one died- sort of. It still works but the blades are shot and it's not running as well. So, I'm buying a new set and decided to buy the same one since it lasted over 4-years. FOUR_YEARS!!! The noise level is a bit loud but our Poodle is used to it. This is the LONGEST I've ever had a set of clippers for our dog. The last brand was Andis and that one lasted only a year. I shave our Poodle every 5-6 weeks and he only sees me as I trust no one with our dog. GREAT_BUY!
customer_reviews.author: PiTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Not just for dogs! Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my military husband and his weekly head shaving. The lowest setting works great! We go over his head with a razor afterwards. This trimmer is quiet. Lighter than others we've used (including "human" hair trimmers) without losing cutting power. It fits nicely in your hand and the cord is quite long. For someone who is looking for a trimmer for their pet, we'd recommend this for sure. (I've had dogs and used trimmers on them that were just okay compared to this trimmer.) All the different size combs, the lube, a tiny brush and even scissors come with it. All fits easily into the hard case. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: canadianlilyberry

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with thinner hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace another Wahl pet clipper device that wore out. They're nice clippers, come with a lot of accessories, and are well-made and quieter than others I've used. I have 3 Shih Tzus each with different fur. The clippers work well on the two that have thinner hair, but they're a problem with the third Shih Tzu who has a thicker undercoat. They literally won't cut through his hair and make a horrific noise if I try. If your dogs have finer hair and lack a fluffy undercoat, then these will work great. If they have thick hair or an undercoat of any kind, you will need something with more power.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Made SUCH a difference
customer_reviews.text: I had just been using my husbands old clippers these worked so much better! My dog could sense it too and felt more relaxed. I have a small dog with wire/soft hair. I don’t need to stop and oil at all! 100% great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but this was an easy task with this device
customer_reviews.text: my pupper hasn't had all her shots yet and her hair was getting out of control. as a DIY type of person, I figure I'd groom her myself. luckily for me, shes not a runner and will allow you to do almost anything to her. I have had no prior experience in grooming dogs or even using a hair clipper, but this was an easy task with this device. it comes with extra sharp scissors which are necessary for cutting hair on fidgety dogs. comes with different sized attachements, which for my yorkie is much needed. All this kit needs is a detailer/trimmer, which can be purchased for under $20, because the clipper wont get between the paw pads
customer_reviews.author: BloopBloop

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it, so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is a "first use" review, and may be subject to change, once I've had a chance to groom my dog a few more times. That said, the first grooming could not have gone better: the directions are clear, the kit is comprehensive (shears, comb, oil, varied attachments, etc), and the shears themselves are comfortable to hold and provide excellent results. I'm actually looking forward to the next grooming!
customer_reviews.author: NW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: My dog could use a grooming every 6-8 weeks (yorkie mix with long hair), which gets pricey. I figured I would give it a try on my own to see what happens. It was really simple, fast, and is such a money-saver! I hope to get more skilled as I continue to practice, but for a first timer, I think it turned out great. My dog scares easily, and while the on/off button made her jump a bit, she didn't mind the quiet humming once I started. I am really impressed with the quality of the razor and love the accessories, which were super helpful. You really can't go wrong with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jstats

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good clipper! Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this a couple of years ago, but I was going through and doing some reviews and saw I had never reviewed this item. Seriously, This pet clipper has saved me hundreds of dollars since I now groom my dog myself instead of paying the extremely high price of sending him to the pet groomer. This is a really good clipper! Highly recommend it! It will pay for itself the 1st time you use it! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Work good for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are not the greatest quality clippers in the world, but they are well worth it for the price. This is our second pair of the same clippers. We shave our golden retriever and they cut nicely. However, when they get dull, it is cheaper to just buy new clippers rather than try to buy new blades for it.
customer_reviews.author: Seth and Jessica Wellman

customer_reviews.title: Not for Shih Tzu's
customer_reviews.text: Does this product work? Yes and no. Yes, it will cut hair. No, it will not cut a shih tzu's hair. I'm sending my dog to the groomers (which i hate doing, it stresses him out so bad) to get a short summer cut, then in about 2 weeks when his hair starts growing, I plan to try to trim him with these. I think they will work as a maintenance thing, but they definitely do not work after his hair has gotten over an inch long.
customer_reviews.author: abbk08

customer_reviews.title: Has saved me hundreds in just a few months
customer_reviews.text: My poodle loves getting his hair cut this way. I and my husband have cut my standard poodle classic grooming without any expensive groomer and everyone keeps asking where we get our dog groomed and saying how nice he looks. Huge savings with this. As long as your dog has the personality to be groomed it will be a lifesaver. My Yorkie in the other hand will shred me for the slightest offense. Consider your dog breed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lin

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Not bad but I have a mini golden doodle with even straight to wavy hair and even after a bad and brush twice, once with a brush sided comb and the other with a medal sided comb, the clippers still get caught up in his hair and I have to constantly clean out the clippers and I would have to trim him 3 or 4 times to get the length that I want which is only 2 inches shorter and his hair is approximately 2-3 inches long. I need more professional type.
customer_reviews.author: sarah a wehmeier

customer_reviews.title: Saved me money and time.
customer_reviews.text: Alright finally used these last night and I'm totally pleased so far. Some reviews say they dont last long and I can't speak to that, but at $60 to get him groomed vs the price I paid I'm definitely pleased. Meaning I saved money and time. I have a small longhair chihuahua and when I dont take him to the groomers I have used mens beard clippers from Wahl or Conair. These clippers are definitely more heavy duty, but I'm not sure how they'd hold up on a larger dog. Also these clippers were much faster and easier to use. I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend..gets the job done!  Already has paid for itself and saved $40
customer_reviews.text: This is a good trimmer. Not a 5 star rating ONLY because it was difficult handling the long soft hair of my Himalayan cat. But, this did a great job in getting the pet trimmed eventually. The key to small animals with this type of hair is to scissor cut the hair first to reduce the length. It's faster and easier. After that, the trimmer worked very well. We tried another trimmer recommended and sold in a pet store for over $100, but this one worked better. Couple that with the Wahl warranty and return policy, this is a product you can't miss with.
customer_reviews.author: cruzeinNJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clippers!
customer_reviews.text: First-time dog groomers here. These clippers work amazingly well! There are several attachments and an instructional dvd on different cuts for different breeds of dogs. It came in a nice sturdy case and even if it worked just the first time, it was still cheaper than having her groomed once. Fortunately, it’s a great quality product that we anticipate will do many haircuts. It did get hot after an hour of use, but that is to be expected. It cooled after a short break and worked great right off the bat again. We are very impressed with these clippers! And the red color is beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: MsGrib01

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers
customer_reviews.text: My son is a barber and recommended these clippers for DIY haircuts during the shutdown. I've never done a haircut before, so found some YouTube videos and proceeded. I cut my husband's hair, and the results were really good. The guards prevent major mistakes and the video provided tips for fading. Really pleased. My husband decided that I am now his barber.
customer_reviews.author: Rosy

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Our Maltese puppies were quite matted. I had to totally remove patches of hair on both dogs to create a starting point. Once their hair was combed out I was able to use this clipper. (I used a smaller trimmer to remove the matting) This clipper worked as expected. The dogs fur is very uneven because of the shaved and almost shaved areas. NOW that we have a starting point I think maintaining them will be easier and the fur will even out as the low spots grow back in. So far I am pleased with this product and the $130 per trip to the groomers I will be saving.
customer_reviews.author: D D.

customer_reviews.title: It's hot, way too hot!!
customer_reviews.text: Seemingly a great little grooming package. Works pretty well but it gets really hot. After 10 minutes you can't stand to hold it anymore. Maybe some Kevlar gloves or something. Can't see anything that gets this hot lasting too long! Oh yeah, your dog will hate you for 3 days if you try to groom him/her yourself. Let a professional suck up all that hate!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CUT MY STANDARD POODLE PUPPY
customer_reviews.text: After attempting to get my 6mo old poodle groomed 3 times and being told he’s “too happy” and possibly needing to be sedated (which seemed ridiculous to me). So I saw these on here and said, screw it, I’m going to try and groom him myself! His hair was 5-6in long in some spots, and after 40min it started getting hot. So I letbit cool down and gave my pup a break. I then continued to groom him and finished it in about a total time of 1.5hrs. Being my first time grooming, these cutters did an excellent job and took a couple mats right out of his fur. I am very impressed and can’t wait to keep trying!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to purchase these based on some reviews. I am so glad I got these. I bought a different brand with better ratings and returned them because they didn't work at all. These clippers cut through my retriever's hair with no effort. They are not that noisy. They do get hot after about 30 minutes of constantly running, but cool down pretty quick. I like that it comes with an apron to cover yourself with and several attachments. I recommend these to any animal owner looking to groom your pet yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grooming kit
customer_reviews.text: I have an Aussiedoodle and this set works great on her. I was impressed with the quality of the clippers. I have used this multiple times now and have no complaints. It is easy to use. The guard clips are easy to change and have held up nicely. Well worth the investment! I’d buy this set again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Figured I would give these a shot and they seem to work well. They do get very warm even after lubricating and cleaning out the hair frequently. I wish the cord was a bit longer to allow for better maneuverability around the dog and table.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Great Clippers!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW this clipper works great!! I gave two of my long haired cats the Lion Cut. I'm not a groomer. I followed the directions with the tutorial CD. One of my cats had terrible mats all over him and these clippers cut through them. I am so incredibly proud of myself for doing such a good job! I know the clippers take the credit but I didn't think it was going to be this easy!! I have tried grooming my cats in the past and never had any luck. I highly recommend these clippers for cats and dogs!!! So easy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ncy Ros

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not for fine dense fur
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my Himalayan mix cat whose fur is very fine but he has a ton of it so he gets horribly matted all over his body. I am not crazy about this tool. It got hot to hold. It got stuck in the fur a lot. The noise level is fine, same as a trimmer made for human use, but when it got stuck in fur it would make a loud buzzing sound and freak out my already freaked out cat even more. I used it so I can’t return it, it’s not awful, but definitely not ideal for fine, soft, dense cat fur.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan K

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a maltipoo and during the first use the Clippers began to not work properly. Made 1 pass then the clippers began to pull hair more than cut. Adjusted blades as suggested to no avail. Extremely disappointed actually! I’ve bought clippers from Walmart over years passed, for much cheaper, that have well exceeded the usage of these clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set
customer_reviews.text: I got this to trim my dog and it is great. I love the various sizes of the depth/length clips that go on the trimmers. It wasn't too heavy and wasn't hard to understand how to use. This set comes with a dvd which is very helpful. My dog didn't run from it so it must not sound that scary. Cuts great and quickly. The cut came out great on him and I am no dog groomer. I just didn't want to keep spending money out of my tight budget on something I felt I could achieve myself. The apron thing seemed a bit flimsy, but I didn't need it anyway. I would absolutely recommend this if ever asked.
customer_reviews.author: V B

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I have a Great Pyr that lives on our acreage and these clippers worked amazing and less than half the price of other recommended ones. Going to save us tons of money since we no longer have to go to the groomers and he has hated all the other clipper that we have tried. The plate may get a little hot but after a little break for the both of us it took no time at all. We used the Oster Undercoat Rake ( before and these clippers glided straight through. Just make sure you go with the hair and not against it while using on the core body area.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Show pig perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We have show livestock, pigs to be exact. We have large clippers to do the entire body but we're having a hard time finding clippers that would get the detail areas, head, tail & feet. These clippers are amazing. We clipped 3 animals and loaned them to the local FFA teacher. He was so impressed with the quality job they did he ordered himself a set. We cleaned them well and sprayed a cooling line while using them. If we can get 2 show seasons out of them I would be happy. It's close to impossible to find small detail clippers under $100. We hit the jackpot with these.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Read the fine print !
customer_reviews.text: It does say that these clippers are ideal for light to medium coats ( no matting ) I have a large golden doodle, very thick dense coat. His legs get a little matted, and at first the clippers handled it just fine, but now i'm not sure if the blades are worn out already or what. I've readjusted/cleaned/oiled the blades exactly as described to no avail. You do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Moccoo

customer_reviews.title: My dog is grateful :-)
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with my purchase. One of my dogs gets a shave twice during the summer months. I always had to make special arrangements to be present during her grooming because she is petrified of strangers handling her. Now, she is relaxed enough to the point that I think she enjoys it. She has a double coat and it was a breeze for me to get fantastic results. I should state that I am not a power user nor am I doing fancy grooming but (for me) this was one of the best purchases I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Marena

customer_reviews.title: Barely cut Schnoodle's hair.
customer_reviews.text: While the size is good, the clippers are worthless. Following the limited instructions that came with the unit, I was trimming our Schnoodle in no time, but it clogged up after two passes. I had to continually remove the blades to clean them. And when they did trim, they barely cut her hair at all. My older Wahl clippers did better, but their chatter spooks the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sande

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy vibrations
customer_reviews.text: Clippers are not extremely loud. However, they have a very deep heavy type vibration that my poodle just could not tolerate. My dog is 3 years old and very use to professional grooming. I should have purchased clippers with truly low vibration. I would not recommend to a friend. I will not be returning them, my fault for not knowing better. Never was able to attempt clipping. Could not put my dog through the stress.
customer_reviews.author: MG2105

customer_reviews.title: Great little gem !!!
customer_reviews.text: Saved time and money!! Great little gadget Never had groomed before but hey all went great Noise is like a loud humming and came with various blades to choose from. I started out with a 6 to make sure I was comfortable and went down to a 3 to finish. One draw back: scissors are very dull and had to use kitchen ones. Great buy for the money. I have a Westie FYI
customer_reviews.author: V.Lee

customer_reviews.title: Got 4 good cuts and then into the trash bin they went
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect much for the price, still saved me money over a professional groomer but after 4 cuts, these things had it. I would not buy again, I would prefer a better quality clipper, even if that means paying quite a bit more. I am looking at the ones that have blades that are interchangeable and pop off.
customer_reviews.author: Tuna Can Tony

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few months and have used them about a 1/2 dozen times and their done. They worked great at first but have gotten progressively worse to the point they no longer cut. I tried every which adjustment to bring them back to life to no avail. They were religiously oiled and cleaned too.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Goldens or Labs.
customer_reviews.text: NOT GOOD FOR LONG HAIR THICK COAT DOGS. Would not cut my golden retriever very well. I had to keep give over and over her to get the trim to the level I wanted. Def not for large dogs as indicated in the description...especially if they have thick coats like goldens or labs.
customer_reviews.author: Archie1980

customer_reviews.title: Better than others
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th trimmer I buy for my Springer Spaniel, to my surprise being less than half the price of the other ones that I have bought, it actually worked better. I start with the number 3 attachment, then switch to number one, then without attachments position the setting lever on the side parallel to the trimmer body, result is a nice short trim that eliminates smelly hair and a breeze to wash. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut and overheats!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer hardly cuts my dog's soft non wiry hair at all. It began to overheat within 15 minutes of use. I have a small dog with a silky coat and after trying numerous guards I got only tiny tufts of hair removed. I will not be using this trimmer again and consider the purchase a complete waste of money. I specifically bought this brand because it was meant for pets and am sorely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Clipper!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I saw a bunch of cordless animal clippers but the thought of having to recharge it all the time made me get a corded one. I LOVE that it already comes with scissors and a comb and lots of guards to choose from. As well as oil for the razor and an apron. I just use this on my one dog because I was paying $75 a month to groom her. This is SO much better. I was afraid I was going to hurt her somehow but as long as you go slow and careful it’s not a problem. The clipper does get really hot but that’s to be expected with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Too loud
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this so much, but it was too loud it scared my toy poodle. The tool was bit heavy but I could tell this was legit and good quality. Not for small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Blasian

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy. Work half the time.
customer_reviews.text: High expectations for these after looking at a few reviews but these do not function properly. They work part of the time with no problems but then jam up rendering them useless until it clears. I keep them oiled and have adjusted them many of times. Still no luck. I’ve used more expensive pairs which work great but thought I’d give these a go. When it comes to clippers, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Flo

customer_reviews.title: Nice little kit
customer_reviews.text: My dog's hair gets crazy long and dirty, but he's too much of a runt for me to drop 50 bucks every time I want to get him groomed, and cutting his fur with scissors is time-consuming and looks bad. These clippers make it easy to cut his hair uniformly and quickly. I was expecting them to get tangled in my dog's thick fur but the blades cut right through. Comes with a nice box, extensions, and even a bib. Paid for itself already.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Y.

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to professional grade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my Pomeranian - Chihuahua mix pups and the clippers worked great; I found them comparable to my $200+ professional clippers that broke. The only thing I'd be cautious about is not trimming two dogs back to back; the clipper blade itself got warm from running so long on long-haired breed.
customer_reviews.author: Christen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, gets a bit hot, works well
customer_reviews.text: I opened it up and sheared long hair cat and a coyote (our dog). The dog sat still and looks good but the cat acted like I put her in a blender so not so well with her. When I was able to cut the cat's hair it took off HUGE goobs of hair without issue. I'll get her again! The dog was a bit straggly but the shaver still cleaned the hair off with ease. I noticed it did get a bit warm but it also cut 1 solid cubic foot of fur. Works very well and has already saved us more than it cost!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great pet clipper
customer_reviews.text: I groom my dog at home and have tried a few pet clippers and these provide me with the professional grooming look home groomers look for. The edges are clean, there are various length options available via the adjustable built-in blade, as well as multiple clipper head attachments. Also, the product does not overheat. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great for trimming pets. I have tried the cheap ones made for humans that you buy in the store, but a waist of money. Good product here and it will pay for it's self. P. S. 11/28/19 Been using this for a while now. Great product. Only problem is it gets too warm to use after about 29 to 30 minutes of intermittent running. We have a 2 large dogs and we have to let it cool about an hour between dogs. My only complaint. Our answer was to buy two. 👍
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Really great unit for the bichon frise do it yourself haircut
customer_reviews.text: We are on our third pair of these in three years but you have to understand... our bichon frises hair grows pretty fast and we keep it trimmed about once per month. Has saved us a lot of money versus a pro haircut for a dog. I wish they just sold a replacement clipper head unit because the motor doesn’t seem to ever go out.
customer_reviews.author: dinowilliams

customer_reviews.title: Broke the 4th time I used it
customer_reviews.text: As many have stated, these don't seem to last very long. I ordered them in February and they broke in early May. The plastic interface between the lower cutting blade (the part that moves/vibrates) seems super flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: C. VanSickle

customer_reviews.title: The best clippers we've found at any price. They remain cool to the touch after long periods of use!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs and one of them has the worst hair for grooming. It is fine and clogs up clippers easily. I will say that these clippers, especially at the price, do an INCREDIBLE job. We've had clippers that cost as much as $200 that don't do as good a job. Here's the main advantage. Even after working for over an hour on our dog, the Clippers DO NOT get hot! The blade remains cool. This is the most impressive performance characteristic of these clippers. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: jhwhiteh

customer_reviews.title: Great clipper!
customer_reviews.text: Why spend the same amount on a one time visit to the groomer when you can do it yourself? This kit comes with many attachments to adjust the length of the hair. The motor only hums so my dog doesn't mind too much. I use large towel on the kitchen island and she stays on it, doesn't seem to mind. She's a Shih Tzu and her hair gets long pretty fast. I take off the attachment and carefully trim up the bridge of her nose. I really don't see any difference than when I spent $40 every 6 weeks to have her done. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Went to use my clippers for the 3rd time tonight ...
customer_reviews.text: Went to use my clippers for the 3rd time tonight (7 months after purchasing) and the dang things don’t work - horrendous noise!! I’ll be calling customer service tomorrow so I guess we’ll see how that warranty works out
customer_reviews.author: AleciaKay

customer_reviews.title: A real money saver!
customer_reviews.text: As a lot of people do I read the reviews on a lot of animal clippers before I purchased these. I'm so glad that I bought them. I've had them since August and I groom two of my dogs with it. It has saved me a ton of money and though I'm not a groomer I watched a lot of YouTube videos on how to cut and the different kind of cuts and I just started experimenting. After some hits and misses I finally got it right! My dogs aren't stressed from being dropped off at the groomer and like I said we save money!
customer_reviews.author: Rere9

customer_reviews.title: Good Clippers
customer_reviews.text: I only used these for the first time, but they are nice. The clippers are solid and feel like they have all metal parts. The combs have a nice assortment, not too many or too few. The only downside are the included comb and scissors, they feel cheap. The included plastic apron feels cheap too, but I didn't put it on because it's too hot to be wearing black plastic anything. But the clippers are what you pay for, and I like. Time will tell if they last.
customer_reviews.author: PittsburghRedhead

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like I'm a pro!
customer_reviews.text: We have a labradoodle and live in the south, so it's hot. It was $100 to groom her, so I took the plunge. These had high ratings, and good price. They were so smooth... It was quiet, so it didn't scare the dog too much. Had scissors for the hand trimming around the eyes and ears. And when I ran the shears up her back/chest/legs, it cut nice and smooth, and the hair just fell off to the side. My point... These things are gonna same me a ton of $$$, because I now groom the dog
customer_reviews.author: CAROLYN BREWER

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this more stars!!! I bought a different clipper 6 months ago, the first set I ever purchased, for just 10 dollars less than these. I thought they worked fine, it took about 30 minutes to shave my 10 pound dog. Well the cord got lost and I had to buy a new set and bought these. I cannot emphasis how NICE these are, I gasped when I saw the kit. They look and feel professional. I literally panicked and checked my order history thinking they must have been $140 not $40. It took less than 3 mintues to shave my dog. They are quiet, and do not clog. I am so happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: InkfingersTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wall 5 in one red clipper, animal deluxe, u clip
customer_reviews.text: We'll I am amazed! I had doubts, but I could not afford to purchase another different priced pair. These clippers are so well priced and work great on my springer spaniel. They are ez to use, do what they say they do. The little carrying case is perfect. The scissors they come with are actually sharp and cut thru fur very well for trimming. I don't use the combs. The clippers are a little weighty, but manageable for me. I do wash the dog first then clip him. I will be clipping him for the third time soon. So far the blade stays sharp with the oil and keeping it clean with the little brush. Thanks Wahl!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Parker

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME kit...instruction guide sucks.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Wahl Professional Animal Deluxe U-Clip Pet Kit. We bought this kit to trim up our baby Pom (4.5lbs) and I am a HUGE fan of Wahl as I have a pair of clippers to cut my own hair. The kit is very expansive, tons of different legnths and options. It has that Wahl quality and dependability. Definitely a very nice set. The DVD included sucks. It provides little to no value. I would use YouTube instead. 4/5 Do not hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: !Easy E!

customer_reviews.title: Great practice purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great for practicing if you want to try grooming. These are great to start with. You’ll get you’re money’s worth from this set & it does a good job but once you decide if you want to self groom- you’ll want to invest in an Andis set.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Meets all my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these clippers. Solid, durable, and well made. Functions well even for prolonged periods of time, that is sometimes needed with our labradoodle puppy as she gets used to regular clippings, and I get faster. I loved the instructional video. It gave me knowledge and confidence, as I've used people clippers on people for years but never clipped a dog. Love the colored/numbered guards for different lengths of hair. Keeping the blades clean during use is important for smooth cutting, as with any high quality clippers. I see us using this for a long time to come, and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: We have a long haired, thick coated Australian Shepherd that we used to take to a groomer for a haircut (fairly short) every couple months. Our groomer quit doing large breed dogs and have not been able to find someone to take her place. So we thought we'd try to do this ourselves. This clipper comes with a wide variety of attachments, runs smoothly and is fairly quiet. Does a fine, smooth job...however, the "operators" of the equipment need a little more work and training on the use of the clippers!!! Any faults resulting from the use of the clipper ARE NOT the fault of the clipper!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Great for my spaniel.
customer_reviews.text: A little noisy compared to others but my spaniel doesn’t really care, easily enough to cut my shaggy beast back into her beloved puppy cut just in time for summer. Comes with a good selection of guides and power to cut dogs hair and on occasion a COVID kids haircut too.
customer_reviews.author: Hamish

customer_reviews.title: Yorkie & Me
customer_reviews.text: Well, been using these on my Yorkie with great success. She does wiggle a bit after 20 minutes so have to cut the process short. Now with Covid-19 I had to cut my hair with dog clipper. Worked just great, did need to order 1&1.5 comb for next time. Easy and nice look for the first try. Wish I had done this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference this made! It was taking forever to shave my 2 dogs each summer. My Labordoodle was the longest as his hair is thick and curly. This clipper went right through it like butter! I was done in 20 minutes and my dog actually enjoyed it. Really nice unit. Keep it clean and oiled and it’s perfect. Comes with a small bottle of oil but I highly recommend you purchase a bottle as well to have on hand. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not good for smaller dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog about 12-15 pounds. But this is too big to use for smaller dogs. It's just too wide and awkward. And it's probably one of the heaviest clippers I've ever held. It created large streaks through my dogs coat. Maybe because of the clip attachments being wide. This would be a great set of clippers for larger dogs. I'll continue to use it until it burns out. To me, it sounds like a normal pair of hair clippers. Not loud, but not quiet. The scissors that came with it are normal cheap scissors. But they do the job. Attachments clip on easily.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki A

customer_reviews.title: Shipping service was fantastic, Product quality, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Today I received my package. I did the two day shipping which was as expected. Everything looked in order and appearance was great. However using the item, gave it about 20 mins, it got sooo hot my dog didn't want to go near it. And although it is promised to be silent, it isn't. I tried to let it cool and give it another whirl and it refused to cut any more hair. It would tug my poor baby's hair so I decided to stop. Now she has short spots. Very disappointed. I would have given this zero stars if I could for the product quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Be careful! It has to be just so or it will cut you!
customer_reviews.text: The blade and blade guard want to slip and get of alignment and if they do it will cut you. It requires almost constant maintenance and adjusting and testing after every use. If it's slightly off it will cut you, period. When it is aligned and properly adjusted it does a decent job, but I'm not sure it's worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Powerfull machine
customer_reviews.text: I used to have another machine and had to apply a lot of elbow grease to handle my shitzu hair. Whit this machine is so easy. is a strong equipment and does not get hot as other machines. Easy to maneuver. During Covid-19 times it has worked for my husband and nephew as well. Did it like a pro I was trained by the shitzu.
customer_reviews.author: Xiomara

customer_reviews.title: These work great
customer_reviews.text: We cut my dogs hair with these about every 2-3 weeks especially in the summer... She has learned that the buzzing noise of the clippers is not a bad thing but actually a good thing that helps her cool down. They do heat up a bit after a while of use but I dont know any clippers that dont. I would recommend! Especially with the cost of how much it is to take to the groomers! We have used numerous of the length attachments! and they all work great.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Your furbabies will love it
customer_reviews.text: OMG, these are AWESOME! I have TWO, very curly haired toy poodles. I've tried two other set of clippers that were a waste of money. These clippers went through their clean hair like butter. Noise level is very low, even for my super skiddish and jumpy poodles. I clipped both back to back before the clippers got a little warm, but the guard kept the was blades away from my furbabies. I would most definitely recommend these clippers to anyone that want to groom their little (or big) ones. This is a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

product_meta.title: Wahl Professional Animal Deluxe U-Clip Pet, Dog, & Cat Clipper & Grooming Kit (#9484-300), Red and Chrome
product_meta.description: The Deluxe U-Clip pet clipper and grooming kit is ideal to clip, trim, and groom fine to medium animal hair and fur for dogs, cats, and other pets. Ideal for Yorkies, Cavaliers, Shih Tzus, Spaniels, Maltese, and other medium-duty pet fur clipping, trimming, and grooming of paws, face, ears, touch-ups, and light-body clipping. Powerful speeds up to 7, 200 strokes per minute make clipping quick and easy; this clipper provides substantial power and speed without producing additional heat or noise. This 16-piece kit offers a standard adjustable #30-15-10 blade (Wahl #1037-400) and includes all the tools needed to clip, trim, and groom your pet. Measures 6. 5 by 2 inches and weighs 1 pound. Backed by Wahl's two-year limited and a 30-day satisfaction . The Clipper and blade are made in the USA of domestic and imported parts. No-snag cutting
feature_bullets: The Deluxe U-Clip pet clipper and grooming kit is ideal to clip, trim, and groom fine to medium animal hair and fur for dogs, cats, and other pets.
Ideal for Yorkies, Cavaliers, Shih Tzus, Spaniels, Maltese, and other medium-duty pet fur clipping, trimming, and grooming of paws, face, ears, touch-ups, and light-body clipping.
Powerful speeds up to 7, 200 strokes per minute make clipping quick and easy; this clipper provides substantial power and speed without producing additional heat or noise.
This 16-piece kit offers a standard adjustable #30-15-10 blade (Wahl #1037-400) and includes all the tools needed to clip, trim, and groom your pet.
Measures 6. 5 by 2 inches and weighs 1 pound. The Clipper and blade are made in the USA of domestic and imported parts.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
